MajorClaims.MC1: mass media deal too much with superficial things
MajorClaims.MC2: television, magazines and newspapers pay too much attention of peoples' private lives for all the reasons mentioned above, namely to increase audience or readership and to give exciting and shocking news to a society which feed upon gutter press and Tabloid TV

Claims.C1: television and newspapers focus on famous peoples' lives in order to increase their audience or readership
Claims.C2: we live in a society where the most important thing is appearance and gossip

Premises.P1: Gutter press and Tabloid TV are more and more replacing quality papers or documentaries programs
Premises.P2: Thanks to the Internet, we can go online and have access to information from all over the world
Premises.P3: mass media don't need any more to keep informed people but their goal is to have enough readers or TV audience
Premises.P4: Nowadays, unscrupulous paparazzi constantly follow celebrities just to take a photo while they are eating or training
Premises.P5: Newspapers often receive accusations of checkbook journalism; this means that magazines pay people a lot of money for stories or photos
Premises.P6: there are Reality TV, television programs in which people are put into artificial environments and situations, for example like "Big Brother"
